result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alyssa M Marx

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Documents verified with scanning; Paper file destroyed, retained electronically (scanned).
Def in person & by Atty Katherine Romanowich.  Atty Peter John Cannon appeared for State.  On a plea in Case 15CM106, State moves to dismiss and read in case; Court so orders.
Plea hearing on April 1, 2015 at 02:45 pm.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Katherine Romanowich.  Atty Mandy A. Schepper for State.  Clerk: EZ. (15CM106 Br. 3) (14ME186) Defendant missed court as had mixed up the court date with the Br. 3 file and thought was a day later and then had contacted the court and was advised there was a warrant and then turned herself in last evening and at this time is homeless and the address on complaint is her mother.  State concern is missed court appearances and lack of stable residence and request a small amount of cash bond.  Defendant working through Seek and has been staying with friends. Counsel request a signature bond and believe cases will resolve in short order.  Court reinstates $150.00 signature bond and cancels bail forfeiture.  If matter does not resolve in Br. 3 case to return to Br. I for scheduling.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 1, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
Notice of Bail/Bond Forfeiture - $150 signature bond
Signature Bond in amt of 150.00 ordered forfeited.
Atty Katherine Romanowich appearing for Def.  Atty Mandy A. Schepper for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Case called at 8:46 a.m.  Defendant did not appear in 15CM106 Branch 3 and a warrant was issued.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Katherine Romanowich State Public Defenders Office.  Atty Mark D. Bensen for State.  Clerk: EZ. (15CM106 Br. 3)  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  SPD will represent.  State does not oppose a signature bond.  Court orders $150.00 signature bond.  Hearing scheduled for March 4, 2015 at 08:15 am.
